c:complexType.name: BarChartCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of the Bar family charts.

c:property.name: panelSizeRatio
c:property.c:documentation:
Percentage of occupied space over total space in a discrete axis band.
The remaining space will be of margins between bands.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation: The visual roles that are common to the bar family chart types.

c:complexType.name: BarCommonVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles common to the Bar family chart types.

c:property.name: category
c:property.c:documentation:
The category visual role of the bar family charts is restricted to be discrete.
For additional information, see the base version of this property: .

c:property.name: value
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role controls the height of bars.
The value visual role automatically binds to a single numeric dimension whose name has the value prefix.
The value visual role is required.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:complexType.name: BarPlotCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of the Bar family plots.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the bar family plot types.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: bar)
extension property (ex: panel)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: barPanel_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the bar plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as panel_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: panel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the series panel of the bar plot.

The extension point of the bar mark.
This extension point can only be used by prefixing it with the property name of the plot.
So, supposing this plot is under a property named bar, and it is desired to access the strokeStyle property of the bar mark, the full name of the extension property would be bar_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the value label mark.

c:property.name: underflowMarker
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the underflow marker.

c:property.name: overflowMarker
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the overflow marker.
